xml.brief: Update personal user notes of a geocache

desc.p: This method allows your users to to change the content of the user's personal note from one value to other value.

We want you to know the pervious value of the personal note, because feel that your user needs to know what it is exactly that is going to be replaced. Note, that we do not require you to know - the old_value parameter is optional. However, if you don't provide it (or provide an obsolete value), then your new_value will be appended to the current personal note instead of replacing it.
Current personal user notes of a geocache can be retrieved with services/caches/geocache method, with my_notes passed in fields parameter.

opt.name: old_value
opt.p: The previous content of the note.

opt.name: new_value
opt.p: The new content of the note, this also can be an empty string (in this case you indicate that you want the note to be removed).

returns.p: A dictionary of the following structure:

ul.li: saved_value - the actual value that was saved. Please note, that this may differ from the new_value you have provided. If the note has been removed, null is returned.
replaced - boolean, indicating whether new_value replaced the current user notes (true), or new_value has been appended (false).
